did.abstract: Personal letters from H.P. Blount to his future wife, Loula Blount. Letters including a description (1881) of living conditions and child labor in Atlanta; a favorable recommendation from Judge T. Clarke of Mrs. Blount's singing ability (1884); H.P. Blount's election to the Georgia Historical Society; and a letter regarding the admission of Blount's daughter to the Athens State Normal College (1908).
